title: Live Stream API - Use VPC Service Controls to secure your pipeline
abstract:
# Live Stream API - Use VPC Service Controls to secure your pipeline
[VPC Service Controls](/vpc-service-controls) is a Google Cloud product that lets you set up a secure perimeter to guard against data exfiltration. This page shows how to use VPC Service Controls with a live stream private pool to secure your live streams.
content:
## Limitations
Protecting input endpoints within a VPC Service Controls perimeter requires setting up a private connection to the live stream service and switching to a private pool in the Live Stream API.
## Enable VPC Service Controls enforcement for the Live Stream API
- Set up a private connection between your virtual private cloud network and the Live Stream API producer network using private services access. See [Configure private services access](/livestream/docs/how-to/vpc/configure-private-services-access) .
- Configure the live stream default pool to use the private connection created in the previous step. See [Configure a private pool](/livestream/docs/how-to/vpc/configure-private-pool) .
